righteousness:

 

This scripture is written to a pastor about how he should carry out his assignment and duty. Pastors reprove, it is part of their job description, they should reprove when necessary. They can reprove you outside the pulpit or on the pulpit. They can reprove you by the teaching of the word or call you into their office to reprove you. The saints will not come into the place where they are beaten to shape. If these things are not handled, the saints will be lopsided; these are all part of the pastoral ministry.

 

Your pastor can call you and tell you what you should be doing, they can instruct you, that is their duty. While looking at this teaching I got to know that Satan has done a terrible work in the Body. When believers have been made smart, they are no longer sheep, they are no longer innocent. Satan knows that if you are not innocent and sheepish, there is no way the pastoral ministry can bless you. The pastor is a shepherd, he can only bless you when you are a sheep. You have to be sheepish, if you are not sheepish, you will be eluded.

 

The heads of most believers have become bigger than their hearts, so they find it difficult to trust oversights. We find it difficult to believe and be led because we have become too smart and our smartness is taking us away from God. We are no longer innocent and it has affected our attitude. May the Lord help us in Jesus' name. The kinds of saints that are very common in the Body right now are beginning to morph into a kind of church that Jesus has not set. Saints are determining the church they want, the kind of pastor they want, how the church will look like; churches are even being designed to appeal to the smart minds of the saints. With that which the devil is communicating, you will not be able to partake of the blessing of the New Testament.

 

2 Timothy 3:17 KJV

This kind of man of God being referred to here should not just be the preacher, he should also be a man of God. A man of God is a man that God can dwell in. We can see perfection here again like the one in Ephesians chapter 4, so it means perfection cannot come to pass without reprove, correction, and instruction in righteousness.

Pastors are preachers and teachers of doctrine. There are all kinds of things redefining who a pastor is. Some people go to school to study guidance and counseling and they call themselves pastors. Some pastors are like that, they speak nicely but that does not make them genuine pastors. Pastors handle doctrine, they labour in word and doctrine, that is why they should be given double honour. Bishops are those that function under the pastors of local assemblies, they are not those that have big churches. They serve under senior pastors.

It is a good work to serve under a senior pastor. These ones who play this role are known as bishops.

They were functioning under Timothy as the senior pastor of the Ephesian church. Timothy was not a bishop, he was a pastor and he ordained the bishops so that they function under him. Paul also told Titus to ordain bishops so he could be relieved. Pastors need bishops to relieve them of burdens so that they can also focus on doctrine and other weightier matters. We can also see something similar in the Old Testament where the spirit upon Moses was put upon the seventy, those were bishops under Moses.

 

In your exhortation as a pastor, it has to be done with long suffering. It is possible you teach one message ten times so that the saints can get it. Pastors have to endure and keep repeating the same thing.

    2. Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

teachers, having itching ears;

 

    1. And they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.

 

Pastors should hold sound doctrine. Pastors are supposed to reprove and correct. We saw last week that one of the major works of a pastor is to feed the flock and all these things are part of the feeding process. Correction and reprove flows out of teaching, that does not mean that they correct only on the pulpit, when they see that your life is not in line with what they are teaching, they can single you out for correction.

 

Let us consider what the attitudes of the sheep should be. Jesus has given pastors to feed and tend the flock, to nourish the sheep but you must be a sheep for those things to be a blessing to you. If you take another posture, it becomes difficult. We don't become sheep in one day but we must constantly be striving to come to a place where we are acquiring the attitude of a sheep so that we can access pastoral grace.

 

The shepherd can only deploy his shepherdic role to sheep not to dogs, for dogs do not have the attribute to get the blessing from shepherds. Sheep must be in folds. A fold is an enclosure for sheep; it is enclosed and you cannot just get access into it. If you enter through the window, you are a robber. In looking at the shepherd’s tent, it has one door and if you don't have access to the door and you come in through the window, you are a thief and a robber who is accessing the sheep wrongly without going through the Lord who owns them.

 

John 10:1-2 KJV

      1. But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

 

There is a right access to the sheep and that access is the door; Jesus must give you the right access to the sheepfold. A fold is an enclosure for the sheep. People who are into sheep grazing do not just scatter them anyhow, there is always a door and a fence erected. In this local church, there is a fence and a door in the spirit and the Lord Jesus Christ is the door. Some people like pastoring, they just love to have control over saints but those that are true shepherds don't even desire it. calling to the sheep in a fold without the senior shepherd knowing about it, you are a thief and a robber. As a sheep, you should know when a thief is trying to access you by telling you certain things and instructing you not to tell your pastor.

 

If you are nursing some things in your mind without the knowledge of your pastors and you know in your spirit that those things are wrong, you are opening yourself to thieves and robbers and if you are not careful, it can rob you of life, and the things God has deposited in your soul. You must be careful of thieves and robbers, they are always around sheep folds. There is a shepherd attached to a fold, it is always one shepherd to a fold; the fold in this context signifies local assemblies. Daddy and mummy are shepherds in this house while the associate pastors are bishops under them helping them to do the work, that is the way God set it. Another word for fold is families, local assemblies are families.

(6) God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry

God wants to move sheep into folds because when sheep are in folds, His work over them will be made easier. God can easily access a sheep in a fold with meals for their growth than sheep outside the fold. God's desire is that sheep will be in folds, not that they should be scattered everywhere. He wants to gather the sheep but Satan wants to scatter them. God wants to gather sheep and put a shepherd over them.

 

In the book of Revelation, the angels of the churches are the shepherds of those churches to take those letters, lights, instructions, and messages to them in their fold. If you are not in a fold in the New Testament church, it will be difficult for God to reach you, that’s the reason we are all here in this local assembly. When you are in the fold, accountability and accessibility is easier; feeding and nourishment will not be difficult and oversight will become easy as well.

When it comes to feeding it is very important.

 

You must know how to connect with your pastor and receive grace from them. Your pastors are friendly but they are not your friend. If someone is your friend, he does not have to be your pastor, but if the Lord has chosen him to be your pastor, submit to them.

 

What the Lord does is that he provides spiritual covering for pastors, and that covering is attached to feeding.

 

Isaiah 4:5 KJV

(5) And the LORD will create upon every dwelling place of mount Zion, and upon her assemblies, a cloud and smoke by day, and the shining of a flaming fire by night: for upon all the glory shall be

a defence.

 

The Lord puts covering on the flock upon the lead shepherd as cloud and pillars wjich is an extension of providing sound doctrine for the people. No one knows the flock more than the shepherd that has oversight, even itinerary ministers have authority over the flock. If an itinerary minister gives you a prophecy, your pastor needs to scrutinize it and he is likely going to know. The pastor is a standing prophet, he may not be a prophet but he has prophetic dealings in his life else he cannot pastor flock.

 

This church has gone through stages. I know of one minister that used to come then.

There was a particular sister that kept meeting pastor, because she thinks my grace was shutting her down, so she went to be submitting to him. Of course she is not here

 

anymore, you cannot last in a local church that way. I believe primarily God sent her here, but like you said people enter into lesser purposes, she couldn’t stay, she could not cope with the training, she could not discern the assembly, she taught our own is just perfection and perfection. Discernment is key, if you don’t discern well, you won’t maximize some grace. I even prefer people that leave physically, it makes you have a sense of responsibility that you need to get to somewhere else, but when you are in the place and you have disconnected, you can be like that for twenty years. I used to tell my wife that there is a brother that has been in a church for years and has not connected, of course he gets other benefits from the church like business connection but the main reason he was sent there, he is not benefiting from it, and the pastor of that church is one of the best teachers I know in the body today.

 

All the five fold ministry gifts are shepherdic, a prophet is shepherdic, even though he is not a pastor, he will not take you out of the church, many people called prophets are really not prophets, they have anointings that have been perverted by spirits, the prophetic is one of the most volatile gifts in the body, and are most prone to deception. You will hardly hear of false pastors, you can see an hireling but in the scriptures false prophets stand out. False prophets begin it, while false teachers establish what they start. We need to teach the purity of prophetic ministry. All of them are shepherdic not all will have a pastoral calling to lead a local church.

 

Because you are traveling does not make you an apostle. Some people don't move so much but they are apostles. What makes you an apostle is by calling and by office, it is not by traveling. You can be a traveling evangelist or teacher but that does not call you into the office of an apostle. There are apostles that don’t travel so much. History did not tell us that John traveled so much, but he was an apostle, traveling is not the measurement. Some people turn to apostles overnight because they are moving from place to place, but they don’t have apostolic things following them.

 

An apostle should be accountable to a pastor. There is no such thing as an apostle overseeing everybody that does not have a pastor. Paul had a base, he had guys that could speak to his life also. There is a system of government in the church that must be recovered,

 

Don't be semi-planted in a local church, be fully planted. Be careful of those semi-planted, don't be close to those that are semi-planted, stay away from them, I am saying it on the pulpit now. Someone can be in the church and is planning to go and open his own church, he knows what he wants to do already. The person catches

 

you as a potential church member. If God would send Him to pastor you, it is not in that church. God is not an author of confusion.

 

If I hear about any break away school, I don't take my children into such school because it is a rebel school. Let them have everything, I won’t send my children there. Do you know that the school you send your children to matters? It is possible that spirits are in the school, some teachers have caused heartache for some school owners, overnight they take students aways from the school, overnight students are gone. Same with church also, half of the church can be taken by sowing seeds.

 

Don't be semi-planted, decide; don't be 50% in: be 100%! It is either you are not in or you are in. If you see some people in and out don’t be close to them. Most of them have issues in their life, some people will never submit to church because of terrible things Satan has done in them, they will go to heaven like that, some of them will be pastored in the world to come whether they like it or not because the things that have shaped them wrongly will be taken away, it is a major veil. I heard a story of someone that struggled with church, he moved from church to church, currently his life is messed up.

 

God has a wisdom, you are a sheep, that is how God made us, and sheep are designed to flock together, anything outside that is anti our nature in the New Testament.
